thread.title: Caliber Public Safety Enhances RMS with New Crash Reporting Tool
thread.title_full: Caliber Public Safety Enhances RMS with New Crash Reporting Tool

author: Ryan Hughes
title: Caliber Public Safety Enhances RMS with New Crash Reporting Tool
text:
Caliber Public Safety Enhances RMS with New Crash Reporting Tool
Ryan HughesUpdated: 04-02-2025 05:40 PM
Caliber Public Safety Unveils Exciting Update to Online RMS
Caliber Public Safety is excited to announce the launch of Online RMS version 11.18.0, marking a significant upgrade that showcases the company's commitment to innovation and operational efficiency. With over 48 enhanced components, this upgrade effectively addresses the needs of public safety professionals, emphasizing the company's philosophy of listening to user feedback.
What's New in Version 11.18.0
One of the standout features of this upgrade is the introduction of a new premium crash reporting solution. This innovative tool aims to streamline and improve the accident reporting process for agencies. Key features include:
Advanced Features for Enhanced Reporting
The new crash reporting tool comes packed with advanced diagramming capabilities that allow for detailed visual reports. Additionally, it integrates state submission requirements to facilitate smooth agency workflows. The customizable screen designer enables agencies to adjust their workflows without engaging in complex coding changes. Moreover, a custom rules validation engine is included to enhance report accuracy and compliance.
Empowering Agencies with New Tools
This new feature puts the power back in the hands of agencies, offering them complete control over their crash reporting processes. Although currently available in certain areas, the company has plans for its expansion across more states in future updates.
Usability Improvements for Better Experience
Along with the premium crash reporting feature, the latest version also includes multiple usability enhancements. Notably, users can now access quick references directly within arrest narratives, minimizing the need to switch between screens and reducing redundant data entry. These upgrades are designed to save valuable time while ensuring accuracy in reporting.
Dr. Tammie Wojcieszak, Executive Vice President at Caliber Public Safety, emphasizes the company's commitment to adapt and innovate based on customer input. She noted, "The 11.18.0 release reflects our drive to deliver meaningful enhancements that increase efficiency and improve reporting accuracy for our clients."
Ongoing Commitment to Partnering with Public Safety
This release is a testament to the ongoing collaboration with customers and Caliber's mission to deliver thoughtful solutions that empower agencies to enhance their service to the community. By prioritizing interoperability and data-sharing in their solutions, Caliber Public Safety positions itself as a leader in the market.
About Caliber Public Safety
Caliber Public Safety specializes in providing Computer-Aided Dispatch, Mobile, and Records Management systems to over 1,000 public safety agencies across North America. The company's clientele includes federal and state law enforcement, local governments, and metropolitan areas. With a deep commitment to customer care, Caliber strives to earn trust and loyalty from its clients. As part of Harris Computer Systems, their promise includes a strong commitment to lifetime software support, ensuring that clients benefit from ongoing product availability and advancements.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the main feature of the Online RMS version 11.18.0?
The main feature is the new premium crash reporting solution designed to enhance and simplify accident reporting processes.
How many components were updated in this version?
Version 11.18.0 includes updates and enhancements to over 48 components.
What kind of improvements were made for usability?
The usability improvements allow users to access quick references directly within arrest narratives, enhancing efficiency.
Is the new crash reporting feature available nationwide?
Currently, it is available in select areas, with plans for future expansion to additional states.
What industries does Caliber Public Safety serve?
Caliber serves various public safety agencies, including federal and state police, county governments, and metropolitan areas.
